body_html: Hello. I just finished watching a webinar by Intel called, "TensorFlow* on Modern Intel® Architectures Webinar". It was unclear if TensorFlow currently has support for Xeon phi cards. The webinar made me assume yes but now I'm under the impression that only Knights Landing is supported (which is not available?) and the Knights Corner is not supported. I am just trying to find clear instructions on how to setup my Knights Corner Xeon Phi card to use all of its core when training a model in TensorFlow.

body: Hello. I just finished watching a webinar by Intel called, "TensorFlow* on Modern Intel® Architectures Webinar". It was unclear if TensorFlow currently has support for Xeon phi cards. The webinar made me assume yes but now I'm under the impression that only Knights Landing is supported (which is not available?) and the Knights Corner is not supported. I am just trying to find clear instructions on how to setup my Knights Corner Xeon Phi card to use all of its core when training a model in TensorFlow.
